description: The Quick-DNA™ FFPE Kit provides a simple and reliable method for high yield/quality DNA isolation from formalin-fixed, paraffin embedded (FFPE) tissue samples and sections. The unique chemistries of the product have been optimized for maximum recovery of non-crosslinked, ultra-pure DNA without RNA contamination. Simply digest deparaffinized tissues using the provided Proteinase K, heat, and then purify the DNA with the Fast-Spin columns in the kit. DNA >50 bp or >500 bp can be selectively isolated by altering the lysis buffer conditions as given in the protocol. PCR inhibitors are effectively removed during the isolation procedure, and eluted DNA is ideal for PCR, Next-Gen library prep, enzymatic manipulation, etc.
before_start:
Buffer Preparation

 

Add 260 μl Proteinase K Storage Buffer to reconstitute lyophilized Proteinase K at 20 mg/ml. Vortex to dissolve. Store at -20° C.

 

Before starting, add 48 ml 100% ethanol (52 ml 95% ethanol) to the 12 ml Genomic DNA

Wash 2 concentrate.

 

Resuspend lyophilized RNase A in 300 μl of ddH20. Store at 4° C.

 

Recommended: Add beta-mercaptoethanol (user supplied) to the Genomic Lysis Buffer to a final dilution of 0.5%(v/v) i.e., 250 μl per 50 ml.
guidelines:
Product Contents

 

 

1 The Proteinase K is stable as shipped. Add 260 µl Proteinase K Storage Buffer to each Proteinase K tube prior to use. The final concentration of Proteinase K after the addition of Proteinase K storage Buffer is ~20 mg/ml. Store at -20° C.
 
2 Recommended: Add beta-mercaptoethanol to 0.5(v/v) i.e., 250 µl per 50 ml or 500 µl per 100 ml.
 
3 Before starting, add 48 ml 100% ethanol (52 ml 95% ethanol) to the 12 ml Genomic DNA Wash 2 concentrate. 
 
4 Re-suspend lyophilized RNase A in 300 µl of ddH2O. Store at 4° C.
 
Specifications
  • Sample Size Up to 25 mg tissue from paraffin block or up to four (4) tissue sections (≤20 µm thick) with a total surface area ~20 cm2 . It is recommended to use 1-2 sections if performing the protocol for the first time. Compatible with fresh/frozen tissue specimens.

  • DNA Recovery  High quality total DNA (A260/A280 >1.8) can be eluted into small volumes (i.e., ≥25 µl) allowing for highly concentrated samples. The maximum DNA binding capacity of the provided spin column is ~25 µg.

  • Processing Time As little as 4 hours when processing large amounts of tissue. For maximum yields of the highest quality DNA, it is recommended to process samples overnight.

  • Equipment/Reagents Microcentrifuge, thermomixer or heat block/bath capable of 55°C and 90°C, isopropanol, beta-mercaptoethanol (optional).

 

Product Description

 

The Quick-DNA™ FFPE Kit provides a simple and reliable method for high yield/quality DNA isolation from formalin-fixed, paraffin embedded (FFPE) tissue samples and sections. The unique chemistries of the product have been optimized for maximum recovery of non-crosslinked, ultra-pure DNA without RNA contamination. Simply digest deparaffinized tissues using the provided Proteinase K, heat, and then purify the DNA with the Fast-Spin columns in the kit. DNA >50 bp or >500 bp can be selectively isolated by altering the lysis buffer conditions as given in the protocol. PCR inhibitors are effectively removed during the isolation procedure, and eluted DNA is ideal for PCR, Next-Gen library prep, enzymatic manipulation, etc. Shown below is a schematic and performance overview of the procedure.

 

 

Buffer Preparation

 

Add 260 µl Proteinase K Storage Buffer to reconstitute lyophilized Proteinase K at 20 mg/ml. Vortex to dissolve. Store at -20° C.

 

Before starting, add 48 ml 100% ethanol (52 ml 95% ethanol) to the 12 ml Genomic DNA

Wash 2 concentrate.

 

Resuspend lyophilized RNase A in 300 µl of ddH20. Store at 4° C.

 

Recommended: Add beta-mercaptoethanol (user supplied) to the Genomic Lysis Buffer to a final dilution of 0.5%(v/v) i.e., 250 µl per 50 ml.

components.data: Remove (trim) excess paraffin wax from sample and transfer the sample to a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove (trim) excess paraffin wax from sample and transfer the sample to a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube.

source_data.annotation: Note: Up to 25 mg tissue from a paraffin block or up to four (4) tissue sections (≤20 μm thick) with a 2 total surface area ~20 cm . It is recommended to use start with 1-2 sections.

components.data: Add 400 μl of Deparaffinization Solution to the sample. Incubate at 55°C for 1 minute. Vortex briefly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 400 μl of Deparaffinization Solution to the sample. Incubate at 55°C for 1 minute. Vortex briefly.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 2 of Quick-DNATM FFPE Kit
source_data.annotation: Note: Xylene may also be used for deparaffinization. See the Appendix for more instructions.
source_data.thread_text: Note: Xylene may also be used for deparaffinization. See the Appendix for more instructions.
source_data.body: Note: Xylene may also be used for deparaffinization. See the Appendix for more instructions.

components.data: Remove Deparaffinization Solution from the sample and proceed to next section.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove Deparaffinization Solution from the sample and proceed to next section.

components.data:
To the deparaffinized tissue sample (≤ 25 mg) in a microcentrifuge tube, add the following mixture:

 

H2O

45μl
2X Digestion Buffer

45μl
Proteinase K

10μl

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 4 of Quick-DNATM FFPE Kit
source_data.annotation: Note: If the tissue sample is too large for the digestion volume, scale up the digestion to 200 μl while keeping the amount of Proteinase K the same. Double the reagent volumes indicated in Step 8 & 9 of the DNA Purification section.
source_data.thread_text: Note: If the tissue sample is too large for the digestion volume, scale up the digestion to 200 μl while keeping the amount of Proteinase K the same. Double the reagent volumes indicated in Step 8 & 9 of the DNA Purification section.

components.data:
Digest 1-4 hours or overnight at 55 °C.

Rapid Digestion Standard Digestion
Incubate at 55°C for 1-4 hours  Incubate at 55°C overnight (12-16 hrs)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 5 of Quick-DNATM FFPE Kit
source_data.annotation: Note: The Rapid Digestion is recommended for processing slide tissue sections. The Standard Digestion ensures maximum yields of DNA from tough-to-lyse (collagen-rich, fibrous, etc.) or large tissue samples.
source_data.thread_text: Note: The Rapid Digestion is recommended for processing slide tissue sections. The Standard Digestion ensures maximum yields of DNA from tough-to-lyse (collagen-rich, fibrous, etc.) or large tissue samples.
source_data.body: Note: The Rapid Digestion is recommended for processing slide tissue sections. The Standard Digestion ensures maximum yields of DNA from tough-to-lyse (collagen-rich, fibrous, etc.) or large tissue samples.

components.data: Transfer the digestion to 94°C and incubate for 20 minutes.
components.name: Description

components.data: Once done, add 5 μl of RNase A, mix, and incubate an additional 5 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

components.data: Add 350 μl of Genomic Lysis Buffer to the tube and mix thoroughly by vortexing.
components.name: Description

components.data: Add 135 μl of isopropanol1 (user supplied) to the sample and mix thoroughly.
components.name: Description

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 9 of Quick-DNATM FFPE Kit
source_data.annotation:
1 ssDNA will also be purified if present in the sample upon the addition of isopropanol.

 

This procedure will isolate total DNA > 50 bp. To isolate only DNA > 500 bp, skip this step.

 

FFPE DNA may be highly degraded and DNA >500 bp may not be present in sample.

components.data: Transfer the Zymo-Spin™ IIC Column to a clean microcentrifuge tube. Add ≥ 50 μl DNA Elution Buffer3 or water (add ≥100 μl if sampling 25 mg tissue) to the spin column.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 19 of Quick-DNATM FFPE Kit
source_data.annotation: 3 Elution of DNA from the column is dependent on pH and temperature. If water is used, ensure the pH is >6.0. Also, the total yield may be improved by eluting the DNA with Elution Buffer or water pre-equilibrated to 60-70° C or by performing and pooling sequential elutions.
source_data.thread_text: 3 Elution of DNA from the column is dependent on pH and temperature. If water is used, ensure the pH is >6.0. Also, the total yield may be improved by eluting the DNA with Elution Buffer or water pre-equilibrated to 60-70° C or by performing and pooling sequential elutions.
source_data.body: 3 Elution of DNA from the column is dependent on pH and temperature. If water is used, ensure the pH is >6.0. Also, the total yield may be improved by eluting the DNA with Elution Buffer or water pre-equilibrated to 60-70° C or by performing and pooling sequential elutions.

components.data: Incubate 2-5 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate 2-5 minutes at room temperature.

components.data: Centrifuge at top speed for 30 seconds to elute the DNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at top speed for 30 seconds to elute the DNA.

components.data: The eluted DNA can be used immediately for molecular based applications or stored ≤-20°C for future use.
components.name: Description
